Sustainment: Sustainment Process
   
 

 

 

   Reliability

Reliability Models
A Reliability Model is defined as the reliability of a device whether it is a complex weapon system such as an aircraft or a simple string of decorative holiday lighting. Reliability models are usually classified as series, parallel, or a combination of the two. The model does not attempt to describe the actual physical placement of a device or component within a system, but simply the effect on reliability by its presence or absence.

System Reliability
All systems have many subsystems which compose the entire program. Typically, the reliability of the entire project is dependent on the reliability of each of the individual subsystems. For example, the reliability of an aircraft depends on the reliability of the engines, the avionics, the flight controls and the crew environment. If any one of these subsystems fail, the entire airplane must be sent in for repairs and is unusable.
